required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Momordica Charantia Administration on Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Insulin Sensitivity and Insulin Secretion
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Momordica Charantia Administration on Insulin Sensitivity and Insulin Secretion in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Without Pharmacological Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The hypoglycemic effect of Momordica Charantia has been evaluated in clinical trials in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus. Important reductions in fasting plasma glucose, glycated hemoglobin (A1C), and fructosamine were observed. It is unknown whether this improvement is due to an improvement in insulin sensitivity and insulin secretion. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of the administration of Momordica Charantia on insulin sensitivity and insulin secretion in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
A randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled clinical trial is carried out in 24 patients with diagnosis of diabetes mellitus type 2 according to the criteria of the American Diabetes Association. Patients are assigned to two different arms: one group receives Momordica Charantia, 2 capsules with 500 mg twice daily before breakfast and dinner for 90 days or placebo, under the same scheme of treatment.
An oral glucose tolerance test is performed before and after the intervention. Matsuda index, Stumvoll index and Insulinogenic index are calculated to assess insulin sensitivity and insulin secretion.
Other clinical and laboratory parameters that are evaluated include: Body weight, body mass index, waist circumference, blood pressure, body fat percentage, fasting plasma glucose, A1C, creatinine, lipid profile and liver transaminases.

primary_outcome.measure: Total and First Phase of Insulin Secretion (Insulinogenic Index and Stumvoll Index) After 90 Days
primary_outcome.description: Total insulin secretion and first phase of insulin secretion were estimated at baseline and after 90 days using the insulinogenic index (ΔABC insulin / ΔABC glucose) and the Stumvoll index (1283+ 1.829 x insulin 30' - 138.7 x glucose 30' + 3.772 x insulin 0'), respectively
Insulin sensitivity was calculated at baseline and after 90 days with Matsuda index [10,000 / √glucose 0' x insulin 0') (mean glucose oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) x mean insulin OGTT)]

secondary_outcome.description: The glucose oxidase technique (Beckman Instruments, Inc., Brea, CA, USA) was used to determine fasting serum glucose at baseline and after 90 days with an intra- and interassay coefficient of variation of<1

A liquid chromatography method was used to evaluate A1C at baseline and after 90 days (Bio-Rad Laboratories, Hercules, CA, USA) with an intra and inter assay coefficient of variation of 0.4% and 1.6%, respectively
The blood sample for the determination of total cholesterol was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method
The blood sample for the determination of triglycerides was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method

secondary_outcome.measure: High Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-c) After 90 Days
secondary_outcome.description: The blood sample for the determination of high density lipoprotein cholesterol was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method

secondary_outcome.measure: Low Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-c) After 90 Days
secondary_outcome.description: The blood sample for the determination of low density lipoprotein cholesterol was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method

secondary_outcome.measure: Very Low Density Lipoprotein After 90 Days
secondary_outcome.description: The blood sample for the determination of VLDL was taken after an overnight fast and was calculated at baseline and after 90 days as triglycerides/5
The blood sample for the determination of ALT was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method
The blood sample for the determination of AST was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method
The blood sample for the determination of creatinine was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days by spectrophotometry method

The systolic blood pressure was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of SBP. The value was expressed on mmHg

The diastolic blood pressure was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of DBP. The value was expressed on mmHg
The body weight was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days after an overnight fast, through a bioimpedance digital scale results are reported in kilograms with a decimal.
The BMI was calculated at baseline and after 90 days by the square of the body height, and is universally expressed in units of kg/m^2, resulting from mass in kilograms and height in metres
Fat mass was measured at baseline and after 90 days with an electric bioimpedance scale (Model TBF-300 A; Tanita Corporation of America Inc., Arlington Heights, IL)

The waist circumference was evaluated at baseline and after 90 days after an overnight fast with a flexible tape in the midpoint between the lowest rib and the iliac crest and is expressed in centimeters
The glucose oxidase technique (Beckman Instruments, Inc., Brea, CA, USA) was used to determine serum glucose at baseline and after 90 days with an intra- and interassay coefficient of variation of<1%
The polygonal formula was used to calculate area under the curve (AUC) of glucose at baseline and after 90 days
The polygonal formula was used to calculate area under the curve (AUC) of insulin at baseline and after 90 days

arm_group.description: Two 500 mg capsules of Momordica Charantia twice daily before breakfast and dinner for 90 days
Two 500 mg capsules of calcined magnesia twice daily before breakfast and dinner for 90 days

intervention.description: Momordica Charantia: 2000 mg per day for three months
Placebo: 2000 mg per day for three months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of diabetes mellitus type 2 according to the criteria of the American Diabetes Association (<5 years), without pharmacological treatment (oral antidiabetic drugs or insulin) at least for three months before entering the study
- Fasting glucose: <210 mg/dl
- A1C: 7-9%
- Body mass index: 25-34.9 kg/m2
- Body weight without variations above or under 5% in the last three months before entering the study
- Women in childbearing years must have a contraceptive method
- Letter of consent and release signed by each patient
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or suspected pregnant women
- Woman breastfeeding
- Medications known to affect metabolism of glucose and insulin
- Personal history of liver or renal disease
- Hypertension, thyroid or cardiovascular disease decompensated
- Total cholesterol >= 240mg/dl, triglycerides >=400mg/dl, glomerular filtration rate <=60ml/min or liver transaminases >=2.5 the upper normal limit

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Experimental and Clinical Therapeutics (INTEC), CUCS, University of Guadalajara

facility.name: Institute of Experimental and Clinical Therapeutics (INTEC), CUCS, University of Guadalajara

measure.title: Body weight (BW)
measure.description: The BW was evaluated after an overnight fast, through a bioimpedance digital scale results are reported in kilograms with a decimal.

measure.title: Body mass index (BMI)
measure.description: The BMI was calculated by the square of the body height, and is universally expressed in units of kg/m2, resulting from mass in kilograms and height in metres.

measure.title: Fat mass
measure.description: Fat mass was measured with an electric bioimpedance scale (Model TBF-300 A; Tanita Corporation of America Inc., Arlington Heights, IL)

measure.title: Waist circumference (WC)
measure.description: The WC was evaluated after an overnight fast with a flexible tape in the midpoint between the lowest rib and the iliac crest and is expressed in centimeters

measure.title: Systolic blood pressure (SBP)
measure.description: The SBP was evaluated with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of SBP. The value was expressed on mmHg.

measure.title: Diastolic blood pressure (DBP)
measure.description: The DBP was evaluated with a digital sphygmomanometer with the subject sited down on a chair after a resting period of 5 minutes on three occasions. The mean of the three measures was considered as the value of DBP. The value was expressed on mmHg

measure.title: A1C
measure.description: A liquid chromatography method was used (Bio-Rad Laboratories, Hercules, CA, USA) with an intra and inter assay coefficient of variation of 0.4% and 1.6%, respectively

measure.title: Fasting serum glucose (FSG)
measure.description: The glucose oxidase technique (Beckman Instruments, Inc., Brea, CA, USA) was used to determine serum glucose with an intra- and interassay coefficient of variation of<1%

measure.title: 2-h serum glucose
measure.description: The glucose oxidase technique (Beckman Instruments, Inc., Brea, CA, USA) was used to determine serum glucose with an intra- and interassay coefficient of variation of<1%

measure.title: AUC-glucose
measure.description: The polygonal formula was used to calculate area under the curve (AUC) of glucose and insulin

measure.title: AUC-insulin
measure.description: The polygonal formula was used to calculate area under the curve (AUC) of glucose and insulin

measure.title: Insulinogenic index (total insulin secretion)
measure.description: Total insulin secretion was calculated with the insulinogenic index (ΔABC insulin / ΔABC glucose)

measure.title: Stumvoll index (first phase of insulin secretion)
measure.description: First phase of insulin secretion was estimated using the Stumvoll index (1283+ 1.829 x insulin 30' - 138.7 x glucose 30' + 3.772 x insulin 0')

measure.title: Matsuda index (insulin sensitivity)
measure.description: Insulin sensitivity was calculated with Matsuda index [10,000 / √glucose 0' x insulin 0') (mean glucose oral glucose tolerance test (OGTT) x mean insulin OGTT)]

measure.title: Total cholesterol
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of total cholesterol was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

measure.title: Triglycerides
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of triglycerides was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

measure.title: High-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-c)
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of HDL-c was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

measure.title: Low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-c)
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of LDL-C was taken after an overnight fast and was calculated by Friedewald formula

measure.title: Very low-density lipoprotein (VLDL)
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of VLDL was taken after an overnight fast and was calculated as triglycerides/5

measure.title: Creatinine
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of creatinine was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

measure.title: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT)
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of ALT was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

measure.title: Aspartate aminotransferase (AST)
measure.description: The blood sample for the determination of AST was taken after an overnight fast and was evaluated by spectrophotometry method

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
